name: Two-Person CPR
description: CPR performed by two rescuers with role switching
warning: Coordinate with your partner. Switch roles every 2 minutes to prevent fatigue.

steps.title: Survey the Scene
steps.description: Tap the shoulder of the patient and shout 'Are you okay?' to see if they are responding.
steps.voice_prompt: Survey the scene. Tap the patient's shoulder and shout, Are you okay?
steps.critical_warning: Check if patient is conscious, breathing, and has a pulse. Only perform CPR for patients who are unconscious, not breathing, and have no pulse.

steps.title: If Patient is Responsive
steps.description: If the person is responsive, has breathing, and has pulse, do not perform CPR. Call for an emergency. If the patient can walk, escort them to a safe area where they can rest.
steps.voice_prompt: If patient is responsive, do not perform CPR. Call emergency services and help them to a safe area.
steps.critical_warning: Do NOT perform CPR on a responsive patient with pulse and breathing

steps.title: Get Consent and Check Surroundings
steps.description: Get consent and ask witnesses what happened. Check your surroundings and make sure it is safe to perform CPR. Ask permission from anyone present during the accident.
steps.voice_prompt: Get consent from witnesses. Ask what happened and make sure the area is safe.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Ask if there is someone related to the patient and ask them for consent. Also ask if the patient has a DNR (Do Not Resuscitate). If yes, you cannot perform CPR. Tip: Call the person out specifically, for example: The person in the red shirt, can I perform CPR?

steps.title: Position the Patient
steps.description: Kneel beside the person and make sure the patient is lying on their back on a flat and firm surface.
steps.voice_prompt: Kneel beside the patient. Make sure they are lying flat on their back on a firm surface.

steps.title: Position Your Hands
steps.description: Make sure both your hands are locked on top of each other. Your shoulders should be directly over your hands and your elbows are locked.
steps.voice_prompt: Lock both hands on top of each other. Keep shoulders over hands and elbows locked.

steps.title: Perform 30 Chest Compressions
steps.description: Perform chest compressions with a rate of 100 to 120 per minute and count up until 30.
steps.voice_prompt: Start chest compressions. Push hard and fast, 100 to 120 per minute. Count to 30.

steps.title: Give 2 Rescue Breaths
steps.description: Tilt the head of the patient and give 2 rescue breaths.
steps.voice_prompt: Tilt the patient's head back and give 2 rescue breaths, one second each.

steps.title: Check for Response
steps.description: Tap the shoulder of the patient and shout 'Are you okay?' to see if the patient is now responsive.
steps.voice_prompt: Tap shoulder and ask, Are you okay?

steps.title: Switch Partners or Continue
steps.description: If the patient is responsive, stop the CPR and wait for emergency services to arrive. If the patient is still not responsive, switch with your partner and perform another set of chest compressions and rescue breaths.
steps.voice_prompt: If responsive, stop CPR. If not responsive, switch with your partner and continue CPR.
steps.critical_warning: Switch roles every 2 minutes to prevent fatigue. Switch quickly in less than 5 seconds.
